Pre-Game Insights: West Indies are fit, focused and firing on all cylinders.
West Indies have an eight-match unbeaten run.
West Indies' recent victories showcase a batting lineup with complete faith in each other's attributes.
England's campaign can begin in earnest now, having avoided a first-round exit.
England knows there'll be no room for lapses if their mini-resurgence is to be translated into vital Super Eight points.
Phil Salt's unrelenting approach at the top of England's order has never been more valuable.
Gudakesh Motie's left-arm offerings have the ability to apply a handbrake to all manner of free-flowing teams.
West Indies captain Rovman Powell wants his team to make use of having already played on Wednesday's strip.
Reece Topley predicts strong St Lucian support after England's fans outnumbered the locals in December's T20I series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This will be another outing for the belter of a surface on which West Indies racked up 218 for 5 against Afghanistan on Monday, so a high-scoring contest is in prospect.

The dimensions are a touch lop-sided, 63 metres on one square boundary, compared to 72 metres on the other, but the prevailing wind tends to blow to the longer side, so the big hitters can expect some bang for their buck.
